runs.comm: full on middle and off and it leaves Smith off the pitch as he jams his bat down to drive, thick edge flies away through point for four
on the pads now and he tucks it carefully wide of short midwicket for one
back of a length, angling in and straightening towards off stump. Gayle defends off the back foot
full, swinging away from Gayle who jabs down on it to defend. Off the outside edge down to third man
length ball angling across Smith, who raises his bat high above his head to leave
shortish, Smith can't connect with the pull and it hurries through and socks him in the midriff
beauty. Gentle pace, but a lovely line and length, just outside off stump and it straightens into Gayle, who overestimates the extent of movement and plays inside the line
movement in once again, straighter line this time, was swinging down leg as Gayle tried to flick, off the side of his pad down to fine leg
full outside off and Smith presses forward to drive, may have been looking to go through mid-off, goes off the inside half of his bat between the stumps and the non-striker, races away
back of a length now, angling in. Smith looks to clip it through the on side, doesn't gauge the pace right and he's hit on the thigh pad
back of a length on off stump and Smith is back and across to defend
full now and Smith flows into a crisp drive, straight to cover
back of a length, fifth-stump line, left alone
full now, angling in towards off and middle, and Gayle, feet rooted to the spot, pokes it back towards the bowler
full, a bit of width, and Afridi does very well to dive to his right at cover and stop that sweetly timed drive

beauty, and Pakistan go up in appeal for caught behind but they don't look entirely convinced. Length ball, straightening away from just outside off, and Gayle is squared up by it, missed the edge completely and his bat, coming down at an angle, hit his front pad
goes hard at this one without moving his feet and skies it steeply off the outside edge. Lucky that falls well out of reach of mid-off running back towards the boundary
fullish outside off, Gayle leaves it alone
full, angling in towards off, tiny bit of shape away. Smith defends to short cover
lbw appeal as this cuts in from off stump and hits the back pad as Smith goes for an on-drive without getting his front foot forward. May have been going down leg side, or over the stumps
length ball on off stump and Smith defends from the crease. Off the inside half of his bat towards short midwicket
back of a length on off stump. Smith stays inside the line, looks to steer it square on the off side, can't beat point
nice full length, angling in towards off and middle. Smith comes forward to drive through the off side, goes off the inside half of his bat through midwicket
back of a length, angling across towards off stump. Gayle opens up as he defends towards point
short now and Smith pulls it down to long leg, front leg in the air as he swivels on his back foot
steep lift from just back of a length and Gayle's feet are rooted once again. Sticks his hands up and jabs it away, off the handle into the leg side
similar delivery to the previous one. Gayle was more prepared this time and rose on his toes to ride the bounce and fend it away backward of square on the leg side
Smith is rooted to the crease here to a length ball that shapes in towards middle stump. Looks to hurriedly work it leg side, ends up hitting him high on the back leg

dropped! Nasir Jamshed comes in from third man as Smith steps out and looks to pull a shortish ball from outside off. Thick edge drops to the fielder's left and he slides and it was at catchable height, only to pop straight out of his hands
this one's taken, and it's taken well. Gayle goes for the pull but it's too quick for him to control, and the top edge flies to long leg, where Wahab takes a well-judged catch, tumbling forward
full, wide outside off, angling away. Bravo leaves it alone
very full, slanting away from Bravo, left alone again
pulls his length back just a touch and bowls it a little closer to off stump. Bravo declines the invitation to drive
length ball in the corridor, another leave from Bravo
beauty. Closer to off stump this time, and it jags away off the pitch. Bravo squares up as he pushes at it uncertainly, in the end he draws his bat inside the line and makes it look like a leave
this one straightens in towards off stump and Bravo is back and across to defend. Excellent over from Sohail, a maiden
back of a length on off, angling away. Smith shoulders arms
ooh. That's in the corridor and Smith pushes his bat at it, and is beaten by exaggerated bounce. Akmal collects over his left shoulder
short and wide and Smith reaches out and slaps it away to the cover point boundary
back of a length on middle stump and he shuffles across to defend into the on side
shortish ball, too close to cut, too much bounce too, and Smith is beaten by a long way
shortish, pulled away towards long leg
short and wide and it's easily put away by Smith, who cuts with an unfettered bat-swing, gets it into the gap to the left of backward point

that was a touch short but it was still at stump height and Smith had to adjust to be able to pull that. Yasir, who's on the field for Jamshed, runs around to his right from long leg and puts in the slide to stop it at the boundary
back of a length, angling into the pads. Extra bounce and maybe some inward movement, Smith misses the flick and it hits him on the thigh pad
back of a length on off stump, pushes it into the covers off the back foot
gone! That's a lovely delivery, fourth-stump line and Smith pushes at it away from his body, edge carries through at a nice waist height to Haris at second slip. Caught Sohail bowled Sohail.
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, poked away to third man
back of a length on off stump. Samuels takes a big back-and-across step to defend
length ball on off stump and he simply stands there and punches through the line, on the up. Stunning shot, but short cover is in the way
a little wider outside off now and Samuels doesn't move his feet. Jumps in the air and pokes away from his body to push it towards point
shortish and Samuels opens up, moves his front leg out of the way and swivels his body through the pull, up and into the vacant area at deep midwicket
tries to repeat the shot and there'e extra bounce and the top-edge flies high in the air but fine leg is in the circle and there's no one on the boundary to catch it
shortish, width outside off, and he stands tall and slaps it away to the right of third man
ooh. That leaves him in the corridor, back of a length, and he pushes hard at it with his hands, his feet follow only after the ball has beaten his edge
a little fuller and closer to off stump and he hops in the air and pushes it towards backward point
full now, outside off, and he drives on the up and sends it screaming into the gap between bowler and mid-off
looks to repeat the shot and Sohail bowls this smartly, pulling his length back a touch and getting it to move away off the pitch to beat the edge by a big distance
now he shuffles across and gets closer to the line, punches with a straight bat to find the gap to the left of cover. Didn't look to hit this too hard
back of a length on off stump. Samuels stays inside the line and punches it away to the right of Irfan at third man
length ball on off stump, no spin, defended into the off side
a bit slower, brings Bravo forward to defend to short cover
a touch shorter, spins in and cramps Bravo as he goes on the back foot, punches it to the man at short cover
tossed up outside off and he goes hard at the drive and slices it in the air towards deep point
slider on a length, angling in. Samuels looks to make room, is cramped, pushes it out into the covers
again he goes on the back foot to punch through cover, the angle cramps him and he plays with a straight bat to short midwicket
tossed up, angling in towards off. Bravo defends to short midwicket
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
slower, tossed up outside off. Gets on the front foot and opens his bat face to dab it to short third man
long hop outside off and he rocks back to pull with the turn, wide of long-on
a bit of flight outside off, too much width, and he leans back and cuts hard towards deep point
a bit of flight, angling in towards off. Samuels looks to drive through the off side, it doesn't turn and it pops off the inside edge towards the bowler, lands just short
speared across towards off stump, fairly full. Bravo stays on the back foot to defend
a bit slower in the air and he comes forward to push that towards short extra cover

slanted across and Bravo waits on it to steer it with an open face wide of slip. Sohail trots back at a stately pace from short third man and manages to pull it back from the rope with a nifty bit of footwork
length ball angling in towards off stump. Samuels goes on the back foot and pokes it wide of short cover
a touch short and Bravo skips back to slap it towards deep point
full, on the pads, clipped away towards square leg
shortish outside off. Samuels cuts hard but can't beat point
fuller, slanted into the pads. Samuels has shuffled across and has to play around his front leg, can't connect
down the track now, checked drive to long-off
a touch short and Bravo is brilliant at picking up that sort of length and rocking back, slaps it firmly towards deep cover
slants into the pads now and he tucks it away towards square leg
full on off stump and he drives it down the ground to long-on
full on off stump, worked away with the turn to deep midwicket
not quite short enough to pull and Samuels' weight is on his front foot, ends up hitting underneath the ball, high in the air, but lands well short of deep square leg
back of a length on the stumps, blocked into the on side
a bit fuller, a bit of turn. Bravo has to play around his front pad and he's hit on the side of his thigh

goes for the sweep, again his front pad is in the way and he can't make contact. Spins down the leg side and runs away for what Nigel Llong thinks are wides, but it's straight off the thigh pad, huge deflection
length ball on off stump, defended into the off side

got him, has he? Pushes forward to defend this ball slanted across him, there's no turn and Akmal grabs it after a little fumble. Bravo reviews it, aaaand I don't know if there's an edge on it. His bat thuds against his front pad at pretty much the same time the ball passes the edge, and yup, it's not out.
a bit of width there and Samuels slaps it away to the man at sweeper cover
back of a length outside off. Bravo rides the bounce and dabs it down to third man
not short enough to pull and that's off his inside edge, into his thigh pad
a little fuller, angling away from off. Samuels shuffles across to poke it into the covers
back of a length, lovely line, hugging off stump. Samuels gets behind it to defend into the off side
beauty. Fuller, but not quite full enough to drive, and the angle beats Samuels' outside edge
length ball angled across Bravo, who punches it back to the bowler
a bit more width and he cuts it away towards deep point
fullish outside leg, nudged away towards square leg
full on the pads, whipped away to the left of short fine leg
tossed up on off stump, driven to the diving Younis at extra cover
goes back to a fairly full ball on middle and off, skips away nimbly to carve it away towards deep point
length ball on off stump. Looks to work it away through midwicket, gets an inside edge down to long leg
back of a length on middle stump and he hops across to tuck it into the on side to bring up the 50 partnership
bouncer, angling just enough down the leg side for the umpire to signal wide
back of a length outside off, straightens just a touch to find Bravo's edge and run away to the third man boundary. Was looking to play in that direction but maybe not that fine
back of a length outside off, plays late to dab it to backward point
full now, angling in towards off, defended watchfully to mid-off
another bouncer, better line this time and Bravo ducks down low to evade it

oh my. Is that a dropped catch? This one turns sharply after angling in towards middle and off and Samuels doesn't pick the length right, drives and it beats his outside edge (or takes a thin nick) and hits Akmal on the chest
a little quicker and he blocks it back to the bowler
slower now, on off stump, Samuels doesn't get fully forward and defends uncomfortably into the off side
a little wider and he presses forward to play that towards backward point
full on leg stump, clipped down to long-on
angled across towards off stump. Bravo comes forward and defends towards point
length ball on off stump, a bit of extra bounce. Samuels stays back, drops his bottom hand while defending into the off side
fullish on middle and off. Samuels stays back again, hops to defend to short cover
back of a length on middle stump and he hops in the air to tuck that towards midwicket
short, rising ball in the corridor. Bravo drops his hands to let that sail through to the keeper
length ball outside off, driven on the up towards sweeper cover

dropped! That was a simple catch, you'd have to say, Afridi running to his right from short midwicket after this short ball got big on Samuels. Looked to pull from outside off and it hit high on his bat and looped high in the air. Pakistan can't afford to keep dropping these.
full and wide, driven to sweeper cover
shortish outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, clipped towards midwicket
full and wide, driven past short cover, who's a little late on the dive, and mid-off fields it moving to his right
full on middle stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
full on off stump, pushed to short extra cover
ooh. That was angling in towards off stump, back of a length, and it left Bravo just a tad and beat his outside edge as he looked to defend. Bat was coming down from gully, at an angle
unlucky. Similar delivery, similar response, this time he finds the edge but it drops short of Haris at slip
short, a bit of width and a bit of extra bounce. Bravo throws his bat at it and edges it thickly, wide of slip
bouncer, and Bravo pulls his right shoulder out of the way in a hurry
length ball on off stump, looks to drive down the ground and Misbah moves quickly to his right from straight midwicket to stop it with a dive

looks to bowl the slower ball and ends up bowling a high full-toss wide outside off. Bravo goes hard at it, not sure where he was looking to hit it, and doesn't middle it. Rolls towards that straight midwicket fielder again
full on off stump, defended towards extra cover
tossed up slower on middle stump, driven with a lot of bottom hand to long-on
full on off stump, defended with soft hands to the left of backward point
comes down the track, doesn't reach the pitch of it, it's fired quick on middle stump, and he flicks it uppishly but short of Younis at short midwicket
length ball outside off and he dabs it down into the pitch, Akmal takes it on the bounce and nearly concedes an overthrow with an unnecessary flick towards the stumps
down the track, clips it wide of mid-on
short ball and Samuels opened up his body and played a tennis smash from over his right shoulder, to the wide long-on boundary
backs away again, not quite short enough for the pull, and he doesn't connect and he's lucky that misses leg stump
makes room once more, smacks it on the up to mid-off

fullish on middle stump and he shuffles across to poke it into the covers. They run a quick single and the throw hits Bravo on the side of the head as he dives into the crease. The physio's come on to have a look. Bravo's showing him where it hit him, looks in quite a bit of pain.
on the pads, tucked away to the left of midwicket, who's stationed very straight, almost a wide mid-on
short ball, Samuels opens up again and clubs it to mid-on

and he strikes first ball! Samuels comes down the track, I think he may have wanted to hit this straighter, maybe over mid-on. Maybe he didn't quite get to the pitch of it, and he ends up slicing it straight down long-off's throat
full on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
on the pads now, worked away backward of square leg
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, and he uses his wrists to whip that off the back foot towards long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
rocks back to go deep in his crease this time, and flat-bats it to long-on
full outside off, driven to short cover
a bit of width now and that's a poor ball with point and third man in the circle. Rocks back and cuts it away easily between the two fielders
short and wide again and this time he goes for the pull, swats it down to long-on
fullish on middle and leg, defended towards straight midwicket
on the pads now, worked away towards deep square leg
full on middle stump, clipped to the left of long-on to pick up two
length ball on off stump, goes on the back foot and pulls down to long-on
full and wide, driven straight to extra cover
speared into the pads, tucked away to the left of square leg
tossed up outside off, looks to drive to long-off. Haris moves to his left to cut it off, ends up palming it away past Misbah, who was running the other way from short midwicket
length ball outside off, dabbed away backward of point
shortish outside off, cut away towards deep point
back of a length outside off. Looks to steer it to third man, extra bounce causes him to edge it but it drops well short of the keeper
shortish outside off and I think he was looking to slap that through the covers, and ends up hitting it early, into the gap to the right of mid-off
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to third man
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, steered past the diving backward point fielder, down to third man
full on off stump, driven to mid-off, didn't hit it too firmly and that allowed them to run a quick single
back of a length, looking to tuck up the batsman for room. Overdoes it and slides down the leg side
shortish ball angled into the body and he rides the bounce to drop it into the leg side
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
fuller and a touch straighter, clipped to short midwicket
sees some flight and goes for the big drive down the ground, can't get it past the bowler
tossed up again, wider now, and he gets his head over the ball and steers it towards short third man
full, angled in towards middle stump, driven to long-on
Afridi drops another. It's a short ball, turning down leg, and he pulls it hard but straight to short leg, bounces straight out of his palms. It was at chest height, should have been easily taken
shortish ball, comes in off the pitch and cramps Bravo as he tries to punch through the covers. Inside edges and it bounces over the top of off stump
short now and Bravo is beaten on the pull, too quick, too bouncy
full on off stump, driven to mid-on
short again, and Bravo can't connect with the pull again. Has to fetch it from above shoulder height, outside off
back of a length outside off, dabbed down towards backward point
shortish ball and Ramdin clears his front leg to play a controlled pull to deep midwicket
tossed up, angling in towards middle stump, and he clears his front leg to slog-sweep it over midwicket
short and wide and Ramdin slaps it hard to the cover boundary, rolling his wrists over at the top of the bounce
square leg had come into the circle and now Ramdin gets his front leg across to sweep it from outside off, over the fielder's head
full on leg stump, clipped away to deep midwicket
shortish, and Bravo pulls it hard to deep midwicket
shortish, angling in towards off stump. Not too much width but Ramdin skips away nimbly and cuts it away between backward point and short third man
back of a length outside off, not enough width to cut and it beats his bat, which comes down at an angle

length ball, angling in towards middle. Looks to play it into the on side and closes his bat face early, pops up towards backward point. Goes for the single and seems to pull a muscle just as he reaches the bowler's end. On comes the physio again, and they take the drinks break.
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across to defend
width now and Ramdin cuts it hard into the ground, bounces over Shehzad at backward point and sweeper cover runs around to cut it off
back of a length, extra bounce over off stump and he jumps to get on top of the bounce, defensive shot bounces towards the keeper

fuller now, on off stump, and he inside-edges it into his pads, ricochets into the off side. Non-striker and bowler race to the other end and Wahab kicks the ball towards the stumps, lovely left-footed side-footed effort with a bit of a Ryan Giggs hip-wiggle, doesn't hit the target
full outside off, comes in a touch off the seam and beats the inside edge as Ramdin comes forward to drive
length ball on middle stump, turns his wrists to play that from the crease to mid-on
length ball angling away from off stump and Ramdin plays and misses, stuck on the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, shuffles across and works it through square leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, pushed towards short cover, too close to the fielder for the single
shortish, angling into the body. Hops to try and work it into the leg side, gets a painful blow on the left thigh
shortish on leg stump, bad ball with fine leg in the circle, but luckily for Wahab, Ramdin pulls it straight to the fielder
and again, line was closer to middle stump this time. Ramdin pulls it towards deep backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, jumps back and across to defend back to the bowler
fuller now and he drives this to mid-off, showing the full face
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, punched crisply, straight to short cover
length ball outside off. Ramdin shuffles across and pokes that towards point
length ball outside off, whipped to short midwicket
shot! That isn't particularly short, but he's half-pulled, half-whipped it away to the backward square leg boundary
a touch shorter now, on off stump, and he pulls it to the man at deep square leg
back of a length outside off, steered to third man
length ball angling into the pads, a bit of extra bounce and he's hit on the thigh pad while looking to flick
length ball outside off, gets forward to slice it to backward point
short ball angling across and away from Simmons, who had cleared his front leg to make room for the pull. Had to reach for it and decided to leave it alone
back of a length on off stump, dabbed away to the left of backward point
full on off stump, gets forward and pushes it to mid-off
angles this into middle stump, full, and he clips it to the right of mid-on
shortish on off stump, leans back and cuts to backward point
full just outside off, gets forward and drives back to the bowler
length ball on off stump and he goes back and pushes it with soft hands towards mid-on
tossed up on off stump and he clears his front leg and slog-sweeps it with a powerful swivel of his hips, clears the wide long-on boundary, clatters into a vacant chair in the front row
full and wide, driven to sweeper cover
short outside off, cut away to sweeper cover
full on middle and leg, clipped to long-on
shortish outside off and he makes room to cut, doesn't connect and it goes off the edge of Akmal's right glove towards third man
sweeps now, out to the man at deep forward square leg
back of a length outside off, cut away towards deep point
short and wide, cut straight to Younis at backward point
tossed up on off stump and he comes forward to dab it towards point
full on middle stump, clipped away towards midwicket, who's on his heels and late to attack the ball, allowing them to take an easy single in the end
short and wide and Simmons doesn't miss out this time, cutting it powerfully between backward point and short third man. Poor ball with that kind of field
length ball outside off, dabbed to short third man
full-toss on leg stump, worked away to the left of short fine leg
full, angling into middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
short, wide, this time he can't beat backward point
quickish on leg stump, goes back and tucks it off the pads, too close to square leg to get a single
looks for the slog-sweep and doesn't connect. He's very lucky that slanted down and missed leg stump
shortish on off stump and Ramdin makes room to cut it into that gap between short third man and point
tossed up slow on off stump and he gets forward and pushes it with soft hands into the off side. Keeper ran out to cut the ball off but he can't stop the single
down the track, swipes it down to long-on
goes for the big hit over the on side but doesn't get to the pitch and skews it high in the air, drops down into long-off's hands. Yasir takes another catch
full on off stump, whipped past straight midwicket, down to long-on
back of a length on off stump, turns his wrists over to play that down to long-on
length ball on off stump, blocked into the off side
fuller now and he plays a checked drive towards long-off
back of a length on off stump, too close to cut, hits it towards short cover
this time there's a little bit of width and he leans back and chops down on top of the bounce to get that into the gap to the left of short third man. Super shot.
loopy outside off and he stretches forward to steer it to backward point
full, angling down leg, misses the flick and it's off his pad to short fine leg
tossed up on middle and leg and he clears his front leg and picks up his second six with another powerful slog-sweep
sees him make room and fires it in full on leg stump. Defended towards short cover

down the track, gives it the big swipe. Wasn't far from Irfan running to his right from long-on, but he stuck his foot out to stop it instead of diving, no chance of cutting that off. He shouldn't be fielding there.
tossed up on middle stump and that's swept away for another boundary. Excellent technique there, rolling his wrists over the ball to send it scuttling past the square leg umpire
down the leg side now and he sweeps again, doesn't beat short fine leg

back of a length on off stump and that is horrible fielding from Maqsood. He poked it into the covers and sent the non-striker back when he was halfway down the pitch. Maqsood ran in and stooped to pick it up in front of his left foot, like a left-arm thrower, which he is not. Had to do a 180-degree turn to throw to the bowler's end, and ended up not picking up the ball at all
back of a length outside off and he pushes at it away from his body and the ball leaves him and beats his edge
aaand again, went for the big drive this time, beaten again
back of a length on off stump, defended down the ground, past the stumps towards mid-on

slower ball outside off. Simmons made room to cut, had to wait a long time, and ended up hitting it uppishly to point, where Shehzad dived to his right to stop it. It bounced, turned in, and struck him a painful blow in the groin
length ball outside off. Sammy stood up and looked to pull, didn't quite middle it, hit it not particularly hard to short midwicket
backs away from the stumps and Irfan bowls it short and wide and he slaps it away to sweeper cover
slower ball, bounces over off stump as Sammy goes too early into his pull
back of a length outside off, slapped hard but straight to Younis at cover
makes room again, slaps this length ball straight to Shehzad at backward point
down the track, makes room and he bowls a slower ball wide of off stump, ends up flat-batting it pretty much straight to mid-off
yorker outside off and Simmons can't jam his bat down quickly enough to make contact
slower-ball yorker on off stump and Simmons had to adjust and wait to jab that away into the off side
Another, and Sammy has no idea where it's going, stumbles to the floor and it dips over him and nearly hits the top of leg stump
short ball and Sammy swings his body through a mighty pull that doesn't come off, hits the top edge and flies high over the keeper
slower ball, full outside off, Sammy goes for a big swipe and it rolls away off the inside edge towards short fine leg
short, angling in towards middle stump. Simmons steps away and slaps it to sweeper cover
sees Sammy walking across his stumps and bangs it in short wide outside off. He was shaping to pull initially, had no choice in the end but to leave it alone
slower ball, short on off stump, pulled away to the left of Younis at deep midwicket. He runs around and makes an excellent sliding stop
expects Simmons to make room and angles it in. Overdoes it and it flies away down the leg side, past the diving Akmal
another dropped catch. It's Irfan this time, at third man, sliding forward and getting both hands to it only to spill it as he lands. Another short ball that Simmons ramped very fine
right in the blockhole wide outside off and Sammy, making room, has no chance of making contact
slower ball, back of a length, angling into off. Sammy makes room and clubs it down to long-on
looks for the full ball on leg stump, and ends up firing it down the leg side once more
slower ball outside off. Sammy is through the pull too soon and inside-edges it into his thigh pad
another slower ball, this time Sammy opens out and gets the placement just right, pulling it away into the gap to the left of Maqsood at deep midwicket
yorker outside off. Sammy makes room to smack it down the ground, inside-edges it to short fine leg
short and wide and Sammy carves it away, up and over backward point
slower ball, full on off stump, slogged away towards deep square leg to bring up 250
slower-ball, full-toss on middle and leg, and Sammy clears his front leg to send that soaring over the midwicket boundary
good bouncer now, too quick for Sammy to be able to pull. Ends up ducking his shoulder out of the way
slower bouncer now, again in that un-hittable spot, just over shoulder height, just over off stump. Sammy checks himself from playing a shot once again
in the blockhole on leg stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
slower bouncer outside off and Sammy had been backing away to make room. Can't play a shot and it's called wide. For height, maybe

back of a length on off stump and Shahid Afridi takes a catch. It was angled in, and it cramped Sammy, who tried to carve it over backward point but couldn't time it well enough to clear the fielder. Simple catch in the end
short, follows Simmons who was making room, and he pulls it to the man at deep midwicket
that's a very quick, full ball that follows Russell as he backs away from the stumps, and it's off the pad and into the fine leg boundary
slower ball on off stump, and it's right in the slot for Russell to flat-bat it down the ground, between the bowler and mid-off
back of a length ball angling into off stump, and he carves it away to sweeper cover
shortish, angling down leg, helped away to long leg
short ball and Russell opens up and swivels his hips through a monster pull that clears the square leg boundary and lands at the back end of the grassy bank
slower ball outside off, full, flat-batted to mid-off
down the track comes Simmons, swipes this full ball down to long-on
slower ball, length ball, right in the slot for Russell to club it away over the midwicket boundary
another length ball, on leg stump this time, and he simply whips his wrists and the pick-up shot easily clears the wide long-on boundary
full and wide, carved over the covers and goes to the sweeper one-bounce
shortish, angling down the leg side, pulled round towards fine leg to bring up Simmons' half-century
bang. That was full outside off and Russell had been making a bit of room for himself. It all added up to perfect swinging room for a flat-bat hit down the ground that nearly takes Wahab's head off
slower bouncer and Russell can't connect with the attempted uppercut
slower ball, fuller this time, and that's another meaty flat-bat down the ground. Long-off didn't have too far to move to his right but it was past him and over the boundary in a blink
follows Russell with a short ball and he top-edges the falling tennis smash  to the fine leg boundary

there's the yorker as Russell backs away and he inside-edges that swipe down towards the fine leg boundary. Simmons calls for the third and dives into the crease, the throw and Akmal's glovework beat him by a few inches
